description.narrative:
The Bishops of IMBISA plan to hold their 13th plenary assembly from the 22 – 27 September 2022 in Windhoek; Namibia. The plenary assembly is a platform for Bishops and other participants to acquire new knowledge and skills on how to engage national governments, sub-regional political and economic blocks, political leaders and other stakeholders on critical issues affecting the wellbeing of societies.
The goal of the plenary is as follows: IMBISA becomes the prophetic voice in the promotion of the common good in the Southern African Region.
The main objectives of the plenary will include the following: i. For the Plenary Assembly to adopt the 13th Plenary Assembly three-year theme ii. For the Plenary to measure progress made on the implementation of Laudato Sì and Safeguarding of Minors and the Vulnerable in the Region iii. For the Plenary to measure progress on Regional engagement, especially with SADC iv. For the Plenary to be updated on the socio-political and ecclesial reality of the region. v. For the Plenary Assembly to elect new leadership for the Standing Committee vi. For the Plenary Assembly to approve by laws for its internal departments
